issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
When access is denied for an S3 request we should not log a stack trace in the user facing services hosts cloud-error.log:

{code}
Tue Dec 20 15:09:23 2016 ERROR [ObjectStorageAuthenticationHandler:web-services-worker-pool-8] [com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.pipeline.handlers.ObjectStorageAuthenticationHandler.handleUpstream(ObjectStorageAuthe
nticationHandler.java):117] com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.exceptions.s3.AccessDeniedException: Access Denied
com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.exceptions.s3.AccessDeniedException: Access Denied

fields.summary: S3 should not log stack trace on access denied

comments.body: Running through all the S3 N4J tests there are several 'AccessDenied' cases.  I didn't see a single stack trace for Access Denied in the log on the UFS
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
